reviews.review_title: Beautiful location - beautiful garden/spa/pool/lakeside facilities - but not 5 star quality .
reviews.positive_text: The hotel is located in a superb garden on the shore of the lake. The rooms have picture perfect views of lake and mountains and the spa/pool/lakeside facilities are excellent. The breakfast room has a beautiful view. It was a real pleasure to eat there. We came for a wedding held in the garden, next to the lake. The hotel staff were competent, helpful and friendly thoughout the ceremony and the evening dinner. The quality of the cocktail service and dinner catering was excellent.
reviews.negative_text: In terms of guest reception and physical maintenance of the hotel, I have the impression that it is relying heavily on its 5-star status, rather than earning it. The wedding hosts asked the hotel to accomodate early check-in of the guests since the ceremony was scheduled to begin at 16h. We arrived at 14:45 and were informed that our room would not be ready until 15:45-16h. We needed to freshen up and change clothes for the wedding, so we asked if it were possible to use the (not cleaned room) to change clothes. We were directed to use the public restroom below the lobby, even after I protested. I also asked about using the changing rooms at the spa and was told that they were not convenient, as they required us to walk down through the garden. In the end, we undressed, washed and changed in a public bathroom, as people came in and out, as if we were Eurorail travelers in a train station. A staff member came down after 15mins to offer us the use of the uncleaned room, as I previously requested, but since I was already shoeless and shirtless, I declined. I didn't see the bedroom until after midnight. This is not the guest service I expect from a 5 star hotel.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double ou Lits Jumeaux Confort avec Vue sur Lac

reviews.review_title: Unbeatable location in a beautiful hotel
reviews.positive_text:
The location is unbeatable with the proximity to the lake, the views and also the lovely village outside the main town center. The private access to the beach is also incredible.
The room was always kept very clean and tidy and had fantastic views of the lake. The bed was super comfortable.
reviews.negative_text:
This is a remarkable hotel in an incredible location. There are a few things that need addressing that would make it perfect. The first is the fact that they allow people to sit on the terrace drinking until 11.30pm, right outside everyone's room windows. There was a wedding when we were there over the weekend which is understandable but then it continued to happen every evening afterwards. It wouldn't take much to get people to move inside at 10pm into the bar and let others enjoy a peaceful sleep. Despite complaints this wasn't addressed effectively and is the only thing that puts me off returning which is sad as it's easily remediable. 
The other things are more minor. The service in the restaurant is pretty slow and a bit hectic. Could definitely be polished. We also found that the water glasses in our room were not properly cleaned on one occasion. Paddle boards could be free/included and 11 euros for room service seems pretty excessive. Other than these things, we really loved our stay.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double ou Lits Jumeaux Confort avec Vue sur Lac

The place is nice, the person who greet us at the main gate into the parking space gave us great first impression.  The garden is nice and facility is decent. Room is on par of expectation, yet we have little episode during our stay.

The personnel in the breakfast area is also nice. ;)
reviews.negative_text:
I have to say, the person checking us in has little sensitivity of international affairs, if you know little of the situation in Asia, then just don't response to it. 

We had a cleanliness issue on the carpet upon entry, and the same personel (checking us in) asking whether that's from what we have upon arrival. (?!?!) I really don't know how the personnel questioning the integrity of the guest?

Although this issue has been properly solved that night, such unpleasant memories remain.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double Mansard√©e - Vue sur Lac

reviews.review_title: The good, the bad and the ugly.
reviews.positive_text: The location, the view and the garden!
reviews.negative_text:
The staff was rather unpleasant, we got a room smelling smoke, then got ‚Äúsupposedly upgraded‚Äù to one of their old rooms with smelling carpets on the last floor‚Ä¶

When we asked a clean room in their renovated floor we were told it‚Äôs not possible (even though this is what we booked in the first place). Eventually they upgraded us to a lake view room (which smelled ok). This is a such a shame as we had to get angry at the staff for an hour on our first day (when they clearly had a solution in front of them‚Ä¶), the rest of stay felt weird after this episode. This was supposed to be a chilled weekend but it got spoiled by the attitude of the staff.

Aside from that the location, the garden and the hotel  is charming but you can‚Äôt treat people like this if you want to keep good reputation.

Not sure I will ever be back‚Ä¶

reviews.review_title: A wonderfully relaxing stay in a beautiful setting
reviews.positive_text: Almost everything. The setting is absolutely stunning‚Äîpeaceful, picturesque, and truly restorative. The staff struck the perfect balance: warm, attentive, and professional without ever being overbearing. Our room was spacious and well-appointed, with a bed that was exceptionally comfortable. Breakfast was generous and varied, a real treat to start the day. And the added bonus of free parking made everything just that bit easier.
reviews.negative_text:
More observations than complaints‚Äîbut a few things could enhance the experience. The spa, while pleasant, would benefit from a couple of additional features like a sauna and a cold plunge, as a pool and hammam feel a little limited.
Access to the spa is also somewhat awkward, requiring a walk through the gardens in standard-issue hotel slippers‚Äîsomething we were lucky not to attempt in bad weather.
Lastly, locking the settings on the in-room TV felt unnecessarily restrictive and a bit infantilising. The screen brightness was so intense it might have been visible from space, and it couldn‚Äôt be adjusted without calling in a technician‚Äîsomething I didn‚Äôt have the energy or inclination to pursue.

reviews.review_title: Wouldn't advice this place to anyone.
reviews.positive_text: Apart from the view, nothing else was nice.
reviews.negative_text:
Arrival: There was no valet service, so we had to handle our own luggage.

Check-in: I had booked the hotel‚Äôs restaurant in advance for a business dinner, but the receptionist didn‚Äôt even check our reservation. She asked us three times if we wanted to book a table, despite our prior booking.

The Room: Upon entering our room, we found it small, unpleasantly warm, and with a bad odor. Unlike what one would expect from a luxury hotel, no one showed us to our room. When we mentioned the issues to the reception, we were told to ‚Äúturn on the AC and wait.‚Äù I requested a room change as staying in that room was not an option. After an hour of negotiating, they finally contacted the director, who miraculously found another available room. While the new room had a nice view, it was dirty and dusty ( see pictures attached ).

Afternoon: We had a meeting in town and needed our car, but again, no valet was present. After an hour of searching for the car keys, my colleague had to retrieve the car himself.

Dinner: The reservation was for five people, and one of our party has a severe, life-threatening allergy. This was communicated at the time of booking, three weeks in advance. When it came time to order, we asked the waiter what special dish had been prepared for the guest with dietary restrictions. The response? ‚ÄúWe aren‚Äôt aware of anything, and our kitchen can‚Äôt accommodate that.‚Äù After 30 minutes of negotiation, we finally managed to get her something. It took two hours between the appetizers and the main course. When we inquired about our order, the waiter was rude and dismissive. I reported the issue to the restaurant manager, who apologized, but no further action was taken.

The Next Morning: We decided to have breakfast at the hotel and requested lactose-free options. They served us burnt pancakes, dirty glasses, and forgot half of our order.

Check-out: The best part of the stay was leaving!
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double Mansard√©e - Vue sur Lac

reviews.positive_text: The location was great and the view of the lake was really good.
reviews.negative_text:
It was all a little disappointing, to be honest. When we arrived to check in, we were informed that our room wasn't ready and there had been an issue with the laundry. We waited an hour and a half and were only offered 1 soft drink. It is also a 5 star hotel, and you would normally be offered a drink on arrival, which we weren't. When we were eventually taken to our room, it was a dated loft room at the back of the hotel, with low slanted ceilings that you hit your head on when getting out of bed. The shower had no water pressure at all. 
The spa area is 3 flights of stairs down, and there is no service down there, so you have to treck up a mountain to get a drink if you are down by the lake or in the spa. In addition, there was never anyone in the bar area.
The breakfast is charged at ‚Ç¨35 per person and seems to just be a limited buffet with a toaster that didn't work. 
Overall, our stay was very disappointing, and everything felt like such an effort. They are charging as if they are a top tier 5 star hotel (which is what we expected), but it didn't live up to that.

They did upgrade us for the inconvenience, which was appreciated, and the bar manager did try to help once my husband raised some of the concerns. 
We did end up having a nice time in Lake Annecy despite all of this and I appreciate that there were a number of things that are specific to just us, but please do be wary that, although the grounds are pretty, the hotel is quite dated, has a lot of stairs and if you go off season (middle of May) there is little service or availability of staff.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double Confort avec Vue sur la For√™t

reviews.review_title: Our stint at Le Palace de Menthon felt more like a comedy of errors than a luxury getaway!
reviews.positive_text: Great view on the lake if you look out from the lobby or have been allocated one of the overpriced rooms with a view.
reviews.negative_text:
Where do I start: A Nightmare at Le Palace de Menthon

Our recent stay at Le Palace de Menthon was an absolute disaster. Upon arrival at 12:30 pm, we were met with nothing but incompetence from the receptionist who made us wait until 4:00 pm for check-in, despite our simple request for an early check-in.

To add insult to injury, after finally settling into a room with a promising lake view, we were unceremoniously booted out just 15 minutes later and forced into a dingy, viewless closet of a room. The repeated apologies from the receptionist were as insincere as they were useless.

And if that wasn't enough, the air conditioning in our replacement dungeon failed miserably. Our complaints fell on deaf ears, and we were left to sweat it out until the very moment of our departure.

Hoping for even a shred of decency, we brought up our litany of grievances at checkout, only to be met with more hollow apologies and outright lies about complimentary breakfast offers that never materialized.

Our anniversary celebration turned into a nightmare, thanks to the utter incompetence and disregard for customer satisfaction at Le Palace de Menthon. Management better shape up fast if they want to salvage what's left of their tarnished reputation.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double Confort avec Vue sur la For√™t

reviews.positive_text: Die erh√∂hte Lage des Hotels mit Blick √ºber den Lac d'Annecy ist au√üergew√∂hnlich sch√∂n. Der Hotelkomplex mit seiner Gr√ºnderzeitfassade, seinen terrassenf√∂rmig angelegten edlen und gepflegten Au√üenanlagen und dem Seepavillon strahlt die erhabene Eleganz eines 5-Sterne Hotels aus. Hallenbad am See vom Feinsten. Das Restaurant bot in angenehm √ºbersichtlichem Umfang ausgesuchte G√§nge an, die ausgezeichnet und kreativ zubereitet waren. Dazu eine kam eine Weinkarte mit einem Angebot, dass keine W√ºnsche offen lie√ü. Das Restaurant wird sowohl mit seiner Terrassengestaltung als auch dem Innenbereich dem Jugendstilcharakter des Hotels auf angenehmste Weise gerecht. Die Hotelzimmer zum See hin haben einen fantastischen Blick weit √ºber den See und die Panoramazimmer √ºberdies in die Berge mit bodentiefen Fenstern beziehungsweise Balkont√ºren. Das Zimmer war ger√§umig und verf√ºgte √ºber einen  begehbaren Kleiderschrank. Toilette und Bad waren getrennt.
reviews.negative_text: Leider wirkte das Hotel im Innenbereich auf den Zimmerfluren und jedenfalls in dem Panoramazimmer, dass wir bewohnten etwas abgegriffen.  Der nicht mehr zeitgem√§√üe Teppichboden wies deutliche Abnutzungsspuren und sogar Flecken auf. Das recht kleine Badezimmer entsprach allenfalls einem 3-Sterne-Standard (Dusche in der Badewanne, Handbrause, ein etwas abgegriffener Waschtisch und insgesamt wirkte das Bad abgenutzt und renovierungsbed√ºrftig). Die T√ºren, die die einzelnen Zimmerbereiche voneinander trennten, wirkten wie schlecht √ºberstrichene Baut√ºren aus Sperrholz ! Auch das Mobiliar wirkte abgegriffen. Das Zimmerambiente entsprach allenfalls einem 4-Sterne-Standard - und diese Bewertung wird vor allem getragen durch das fantastische Ausblickspanorama, das auch in das Zimmer einstrahlt.  Das Fr√ºhst√ºck  war reichhaltig aber nicht au√üergew√∂hnlich, was man f√ºr EUR 35,-- pro Tag und Person h√§tte erwarten k√∂nnen. Das Personal beim Fr√ºhst√ºck war zudem unengagiert. Zusammen mit dem m√§√üigen Zimmerstandard stimmte dann das Preis-Leistungsverh√§ltnis insgesamt nicht, weil das Hotel dem 5-Sterne-Anspruch nur teilweise gerecht wird.
